definition: A New Account of the Tales of the World, collection of anecdotes, conversations, remarks etc of historic personalities, compiled and edited by Liu Yiqing 劉義慶|刘义庆[Liu2 Yi4 qing4]
life/age/generation/era/world/lifetime/epoch/descendant/noble
surname Shi
to persuade
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin
new/newly/meso- (chemistry)
dialect/language/speech
to tell to

sentences.english: The paper discusses the connotation of the title of Shishuoxiyu.
sentences.chinese: 本文討論了《世說新語》題名的內涵。

sentences.english: The second part is a list of synonymous groups.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分是《世說新語》中實義動詞同義詞組列表。

sentences.english: Xie'an, a character in Shishuoxinyu (Anecdotes of Famous Houses in Wei and Jin Dynasties) attaches great importance to the education of the young of the house.
sentences.chinese: 謝安是《世說新語》中最重視教育家族子弟的人物。

sentences.english: The third chapter elaborates the idea of female aesthetics.
This text is about the grammar study on adverbs in Shi Shuo Xin Yu.
sentences.chinese: 本文對《世說新語》中的副詞進行語法上的研究。

sentences.english: May say "Shi Shuo Xin Yu" is the crystallization which Liu Yiqing and the Liu Jun two people cooperate.
sentences.chinese: 可以說《世說新語》是劉義慶和劉峻兩人合作的結晶。

sentences.english: This book-- is a book that has recorded the true stories of the intellectuals in that period.
sentences.chinese: 《世說新語》一書是魏晉士人生活的真實記錄。

sentences.english: This text differentiates and analyses the modality adverbs which have same form but belong to different category.
sentences.chinese: 文章對《世說新語》的同形異類語氣副詞進行辨析。

sentences.english: Once more, you open the door, And you're here in my heart.
sentences.chinese: 你要是再開門，世說新語，在心裏我還要日。

sentences.english: The fourth chapter is an analysis of the influence of gender aesthetics.
sentences.chinese: 《世說新語》性別審美觀的影響分析。

definition: Western Jin dynasty 西晋 historian, author of History of the Three Kingdoms 三國志|三国志
Gu Kaizhi or Ku K'aichih (346-407), famous painter of Eastern Jin dynasty, one of the Four Great Painters of the Six Dynasties 六朝四大家
Tao Zongyi (c. 1329-1410), Yuan dynasty scholar
almanac
letter/also written 書札|书札
the Three Su father and sons (referring to Northern Song literati Su Xun 蘇洵|苏洵[Su1 Xun2], Su Shi 蘇軾|苏轼[Su1 Shi4] and Su Zhe 蘇轍|苏辙[Su1 Zhe2])

History of the Early Tang Dynasty, sixteenth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Liu Xu 劉昫|刘昫[Liu2 Xu4] in 945 during Later Jin 後晉|后晋[Hou4 Jin4] of the Five Dynasties, 200 scrolls
Zhang Dai (1597-c. 1684), late Ming scholar
Liu Yiqing (403-444), writer of South Song Dynasty, compiler and editor of A New Account of the Tales of the World 世說新語|世说新语[Shi4 shuo1 Xin1 yu3]
to check and correct
Lu Ji (261-303), Chinese writer and literary critic

the Book of History, one of the Five Classics of Confucianism 五經|五经[Wu3 jing1], a compendium of documents which make up the oldest extant texts of Chinese history, from legendary times down to the time of Confucius, also known as 尚書經|尚书经[Shang4 shu1 jing1], 尚書|尚书[Shang4 shu1], 書|书[Shu1]
Xie Lingyun (385-433) poet during Song of the Southern Dynasties 南朝宋
to narrate/narrative
divination combined with mystical Confucian philosopy, prevalent during the Eastern Han Dynasty (25-220)
Shen Yue (441-513), writer and historian during Liang of Southern dynasties 南朝梁, compiler of History of Song of the Southern dynasties 宋書|宋书
